titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: William West Conrad (1904-1981) of Devon, Pennsylvania, was a big game hunter who assembled one of the world's largest taxidermic collections of animals. Early in his career, Conrad worked in the tax department of the Girard Trust Co. He served in World War II as a sergeant in the Army. After the war he worked with the Veterans Administration in Philadelphia. His animal collection was donated to the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: These twelve volumes are the travel journals of William West Conrad. The journals date from 1924-1925, 1935, and 1957-1963 and describe Conrad's voyages to England and Europe, the Western United States, Alaska, Africa, the Middle East, South America, the South Seas, and Asia. The collection also includes two banners from the Adventurers Club, Chicago, 1961-1962, a 1962 membership certificate and a medal from the Adventurer's Club, and a membership card to the Mt. Kenya Safari Club.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Union League of Pennsylvania: William West Conrad papers.
